data.title: Harold Lloyd's World of Comedy
data.meta_description: After his films had been unavailable for almost 40 years, silent film star Harold Lloyd produced this compilation of clips from some of his most popular films of the 1920s. Included are excerpts from "Safety Last," "The Freshman" and "Hot Water." These are followed by longer sequences from "Why Worry?," "Girl Shy," "Professor Beware" and "Movie Crazy." The movie is capped with Lloyd's routine from "Feet First," where he hangs off the clock of a skyscraper.
